page.title: 01BROADWELL-A GENERAL REVIEW
page.content: This Block is a predominantly agricultural one.There is only one village,the village of Broadwell.There are 10 farms.The fields are mainly for grazing,although there is also some arable farming. Broadwell itself dates back to Medieval Times,although the oldest building is an Elizabethan barn.There are two Churches,neither of which are Church Of England <unusual for Warwickshire>. There is only one shop in the Block,which is a very small Sub-Post Office and general store,but there is also an agricultural supplier.The only source of entertainment is a very small village hall,there are no public houses.Broadwell has a village green but this is not used.There are only two buses a week,one being a free bus to Southam Market.The Well still exists but it is no longer in use.
